replies.body: Lmq no.1 C9 no.2 Tsm.3 CLG no.4 agree?

1. C9 (they'll improve, they just need Hai to readjust back to his position), 2. DIG (they can only get stronger with this new line-up, albeit I'm biased), 3. CLG (same as DIG, only can get stronger), 4. LMQ (their strategy will wear out and more objective-focused teams will beat them), 5. TSM (TSM's kill-game is outdone by LMQ and objective-focused teams, they're not making it this split), 6. CRS (they just aren't strong right now), 7. coL (they need a split to get strong), 8. EG (I mean Altec could prove me wrong, but EG just doesn't look too impressive)

"B-but you didn't put my team on top!" Well it's my opinion, this is my prediction from the observation. If I'm wrong then w/e, 2nd and 3rd place along with 7th and 8th could be debatable, but this is how I see it. 

inb4 freesm fanboys cry about their team narrowly avoiding relegation

I respect your opinion but "narrowly avoiding relegation" wut? they finished second.....they could not have been regulated because of how well they played in regular season.....so idk what your talking about, even if they lost to clg and lost the 3rd place game they still would not have been relegated....If your going to have your opinion fine just don't be a biased dick and expect no one to say anything.

...He is talking about predictions for the end of this split where he is putting TSM as 5th place.  Sometimes rereading something if it seems really off can help you avoid needlessly taking offence.  "Just don't be a biased dick and expect no one to say anything." :P

I'm placing c9 in 3rd, I have a feeling DIG and CLG are taking 1 and 2 this split. TSM and LMQ are 4 and 5, TSM is still adjusting to their new players as well while LMQ just moved regions. CRS then coL for 6 and 7, coL isn't ready I feel, and CRS would be really dangerous if Cop and xpecial were in sync, plus I don't think Voyboy has adjusted to mid well enough yet. EG last since they just aren't shining well enough without froggen anymore.

i think it will be pretty similar but i actually think LMQ will be as 3rd with C9 at 2 DIG at 1 and TSM and CLG battling for 4th sadly but next season if there arent too many changes TSM should be back up to first or second

1 will be cloud 9 cuz they are getting better each game( same as CLG). but as far as the top three that will make it to worlds this split, 1 will be c9, 2 Dig, and 3 CLG...LMQ will be 4th and TSM will be 5th (they arent showing any signs of getting better as they play together more).

replies.poster: d e a t h y y y
replies.body: Sounds reasonable, and I agree with 1-3. I'm giving Dig my 4th spot at the moment though. Willing to overlook the deficiencies they showed vs. the ones CLG showed after having improved both of their solo lanes. Can easily change back to CLG 4 and Dig 5 after this weekend though.

i dont agree for now at least, C9 needs to pick up the slack to make top 2 as we saw last week, as C9 is the dominating NA team. i see them getting themselves together, but if they continue with the same performance as last week theyll never make top 2.
http://fantasy.lolesports.com/en-US/join/league/294710/BT37ExytHMRxEpGX0d9M join my fantasy lcs league drafting asap :)

By the end of the split: C9>CLG>LMQ>TSM>DIG>the rest of them. 

Also, "However, CLG is still a force to be reckoned with, as even in their losses, they demonstrated that they have some of the best mid-game rotations and late-game team fights. " 

How did this get through editing? CLG flopped in the mid/late game against LMQ. That is precisely why that game was so interesting. CLG opened a pretty big lead on LMQ, and it took not one, but two Baron throws for LMQ to take the game.
Gotta say, this split has been so far amazing. My predictions... 1. Cloud 9 2. CLG 3. Dignitas 4. TSM 5. LMQ 6. EG 7. CRS 8. Complexity

1:C9 2:DIG 3:LMQ 4:CLG 5:TSM 6:CRS 7:EG 8:COM

It comes down to team fights and overall communication. 

It pains me to see TSM so low in my predicitions. But if they STOP PLAYING with utility mid's and weird things like LULU TOP, and get Wild turtle and Gleeb to start working better together. I believe they can crack the top 4.
TSM just doesn't look right with the new lineup. I think Reginald made a mistake, we need a better jungler especially.
